enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER_ACTIVE
enumeratedValues.description: Asserted while counter is active

enumeratedValues.name: CLEAR_OFLAG
enumeratedValues.description: Clear OFLAG output on successful compare

enumeratedValues.name: SET_OFLAG
enumeratedValues.description: Set OFLAG output on successful compare

enumeratedValues.name: TOGGLE_OFLAG_SUCCESS
enumeratedValues.description: Toggle OFLAG output on successful compare

enumeratedValues.name: TOGGLE_OFLAG_ALT
enumeratedValues.description: Toggle OFLAG output using alternating compare registers

enumeratedValues.name: CLEAR_ON_SECONDARY
enumeratedValues.description: Set on compare, cleared on secondary source input edge

enumeratedValues.name: CLEAR_ON_ROLLOVER
enumeratedValues.description: Set on compare, cleared on counter rollover

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE_GATED_OUT
enumeratedValues.description: Enable gated clock output while counter is active

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Co-channel counter/timers cannot force a re-initialization of this counter/timer

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Co-channel counter/timers may force a re-initialization of this counter/timer

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTUP
enumeratedValues.description: Count up.

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTDOWN
enumeratedValues.description: Count down.

enumeratedValues.name: UNTIL_ROLLOVER
enumeratedValues.description: Count until roll over at $FFFF and continue from $0000.

enumeratedValues.name: UNTIL_COMPARE
enumeratedValues.description: Count until compare, then re-initialize. If counting up, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP1 value. If counting down, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP2 value. When output mode $4 is used, alternating values of COMP1 and COMP2 are used to generate successful comparisons. For example, the counter counts until a COMP1 value is reached, re-initializes, counts until COMP2 value is reached, re-initializes, counts until COMP1 value is reached, and so on.

enumeratedValues.name: REPEAT
enumeratedValues.description: Count repeatedly.

enumeratedValues.name: UNTIL_COMPARE
enumeratedValues.description: Count until compare and then stop. If counting up, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP1 value. If counting down, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP2 value. When output mode $4 is used, the counter re-initializes after reaching the COMP1 value, continues to count to the COMP2 value, and then stops.

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER0_IN
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 0 input pin

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER1_IN
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 1 input pin

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER2_IN
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 2 input pin

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER3_IN
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 3 input pin

enumeratedValues.description: Counter 0 input pin

enumeratedValues.description: Counter 1 input pin

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER2_IN
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 2 input pin

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER3_IN
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 3 input pin

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER0_OUT
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 0 output

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER1_OUT
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 1 output

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER2_OUT
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 2 output

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER3_OUT
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 3 output

enumeratedValues.name: BUS_DIVBY1
enumeratedValues.description: IP bus clock divide by 1 prescaler

enumeratedValues.name: BUS_DIVBY2
enumeratedValues.description: IP bus clock divide by 2 prescaler

enumeratedValues.name: BUS_DIVBY4
enumeratedValues.description: IP bus clock divide by 4 prescaler

enumeratedValues.name: BUS_DIVBY8
enumeratedValues.description: IP bus clock divide by 8 prescaler

enumeratedValues.name: BUS_DIVBY16
enumeratedValues.description: IP bus clock divide by 16 prescaler

enumeratedValues.name: BUS_DIVBY32
enumeratedValues.description: IP bus clock divide by 32 prescaler

enumeratedValues.name: BUS_DIVBY64
enumeratedValues.description: IP bus clock divide by 64 prescaler

enumeratedValues.name: BUS_DIVBY128
enumeratedValues.description: IP bus clock divide by 128 prescaler

enumeratedValues.name: NOOP
enumeratedValues.description: No operation

enumeratedValues.name: RISING_ONLY
enumeratedValues.description: Count rising edges of primary sourceRising edges are counted only when SCTRL[IPS] = 0. Falling edges are counted when SCTRL[IPS] = 1. If the primary count source is IP bus clock divide by 1, only rising edges are counted regardless of the value of SCTRL[IPS].

enumeratedValues.name: RISING_AND_FALLING
enumeratedValues.description: Count rising and falling edges of primary sourceIP bus clock divide by 1 cannot be used as a primary count source in edge count mode.

enumeratedValues.name: RISING_WHILE_SEC_HIGH
enumeratedValues.description: Count rising edges of primary source while secondary input high active

enumeratedValues.name: QUADRATURE
enumeratedValues.description: Quadrature count mode, uses primary and secondary sources

enumeratedValues.name: RISING_SEC_DIR
enumeratedValues.description: Count rising edges of primary source; secondary source specifies directionRising edges are counted only when SCTRL[IPS] = 0. Falling edges are counted when SCTRL[IPS] = 1.

enumeratedValues.name: SECONDARY
enumeratedValues.description: Edge of secondary source triggers primary count until compare

enumeratedValues.name: CASCADE
enumeratedValues.description: Cascaded counter mode (up/down)The primary count source must be set to one of the counter outputs.

registers.name: SCTRL0
registers.description: Timer Channel Status and Control Register

enumeratedValues.name: INPUT
enumeratedValues.description: The external pin is configured as an input.

enumeratedValues.name: OFLAG_OUT
enumeratedValues.description: The OFLAG output signal is driven on the external pin. Other timer groups using this external pin as their input see the driven value. The polarity of the signal is determined by OPS.

enumeratedValues.name: TRUE
enumeratedValues.description: True polarity.

enumeratedValues.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValues.description: Inverted polarity.

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Capture function is disabled

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE_RISING
enumeratedValues.description: Load capture register on rising edge (when IPS=0) or falling edge (when IPS=1) of input

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE_FALLING
enumeratedValues.description: Load capture register on falling edge (when IPS=0) or rising edge (when IPS=1) of input

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE_BOTH
enumeratedValues.description: Load capture register on both edges of input

registers.name: CSCTRL0
registers.description: Timer Channel Comparator Status and Control Register

enumeratedValues.name: NEVER
enumeratedValues.description: Never preload

enumeratedValues.name: COMP1
enumeratedValues.description: Load upon successful compare with the value in COMP1

enumeratedValues.name: COMP2
enumeratedValues.description: Load upon successful compare with the value in COMP2

enumeratedValues.name: NEVER
enumeratedValues.description: Never preload

enumeratedValues.name: COMP1
enumeratedValues.description: Load upon successful compare with the value in COMP1

enumeratedValues.name: COMP2
enumeratedValues.description: Load upon successful compare with the value in COMP2

enumeratedValues.name: DOWN
enumeratedValues.description: The last count was in the DOWN direction.

enumeratedValues.name: UP
enumeratedValues.description: The last count was in the UP direction.

enumeratedValues.name: STOP
enumeratedValues.description: Stop counter upon receiving a second trigger event while still counting from the first trigger event.

enumeratedValues.name: RELOAD
enumeratedValues.description: Reload the counter upon receiving a second trigger event while still counting from the first trigger event.

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Do not reload the counter on a capture event.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Reload the counter on a capture event.

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Counter can be re-initialized only with the LOAD register.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Counter can be re-initialized with the LOAD or CMPLD2 registers depending on count direction.

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Fault function disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Fault function enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValues.description: Continue with normal operation during debug mode. (default)

enumeratedValues.name: HALT_TMR
enumeratedValues.description: Halt TMR counter during debug mode.

enumeratedValues.name: FORCE_0
enumeratedValues.description: Force TMR output to logic 0 (prior to consideration of SCTRL[OPS]).

enumeratedValues.name: HALT_AND_FORCE_0
enumeratedValues.description: Both halt counter and force output to 0 during debug mode.

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Timer channel is disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Timer channel is enabled. (default)

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER_ACTIVE
enumeratedValues.description: Asserted while counter is active

enumeratedValues.description: Count until compare, then re-initialize. If counting up, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP1 value. If counting down, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP2 value. When output mode $4 is used, alternating values of COMP1 and COMP2 are used to generate successful comparisons. enumeratedValues.description: Enable gated clock output while counter is active

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Co-channel counter/timers cannot force a re-initialization of this counter/timer

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Co-channel counter/timers may force a re-initialization of this counter/timer

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTUP
enumeratedValues.description: Count up.

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTDOWN
enumeratedValues.description: Count down.

enumeratedValues.name: UNTIL_ROLLOVER
enumeratedValues.description: Count until roll over at $FFFF and continue from $0000.

enumeratedValues.name: UNTIL_COMPARE
enumeratedValues.description: Count until compare, then re-initialize. If counting up, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP1 value. If counting down, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP2 value. When output mode $4 is used, alternating values of COMP1 and COMP2 are used to generate successful comparisons. For example, the counter counts until a COMP1 value is reached, re-initializes, counts until COMP2 value is reached, re-initializes, counts until COMP1 value is reached, and so on.

enumeratedValues.name: REPEAT
enumeratedValues.description: Count repeatedly.

enumeratedValues.name: UNTIL_COMPARE
enumeratedValues.description: Count until compare and then stop. If counting up, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP1 value. If counting down, a successful compare occurs when the counter reaches a COMP2 value. When output mode $4 is used, the counter re-initializes after reaching the COMP1 value, continues to count to the COMP2 value, and then stops.

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER0_IN
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 0 input pin

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER1_IN
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 1 input pin

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER2_IN
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 2 input pin

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER3_IN
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 3 input pin

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER0_IN
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 0 input pin

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER1_IN
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 1 input pin

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER2_IN
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 2 input pin

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER3_IN
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 3 input pin

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER0_OUT
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 0 output

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER1_OUT
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 1 output

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER2_OUT
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 2 output

enumeratedValues.name: COUNTER3_OUT
enumeratedValues.description: Counter 3 output

enumeratedValues.name: BUS_DIVBY1
enumeratedValues.description: IP bus clock divide by 1 prescaler

enumeratedValues.name: BUS_DIVBY2
enumeratedValues.description: IP bus clock divide by 2 prescaler

enumeratedValues.name: BUS_DIVBY4
enumeratedValues.description: IP bus clock divide by 4 prescaler

enumeratedValues.name: BUS_DIVBY8
enumeratedValues.description: IP bus clock divide by 8 prescaler

enumeratedValues.name: BUS_DIVBY16
enumeratedValues.description: IP bus clock divide by 16 prescaler

enumeratedValues.name: BUS_DIVBY32
enumeratedValues.description: IP bus clock divide by 32 prescaler

enumeratedValues.name: BUS_DIVBY64
enumeratedValues.description: IP bus clock divide by 64 prescaler

enumeratedValues.name: BUS_DIVBY128
enumeratedValues.description: IP bus clock divide by 128 prescaler

enumeratedValues.name: NOOP
enumeratedValues.description: No operation

enumeratedValues.name: RISING_ONLY
enumeratedValues.description: Count rising edges of primary sourceRising edges are counted only when SCTRL[IPS] = 0. Falling edges are counted when SCTRL[IPS] = 1. If the primary count source is IP bus clock divide by 1, only rising edges are counted regardless of the value of SCTRL[IPS].

enumeratedValues.name: RISING_AND_FALLING
enumeratedValues.description: Count rising and falling edges of primary sourceIP bus clock divide by 1 cannot be used as a primary count source in edge count mode.

enumeratedValues.name: RISING_WHILE_SEC_HIGH
enumeratedValues.description: Count rising edges of primary source while secondary input high active

enumeratedValues.name: QUADRATURE
enumeratedValues.description: Quadrature count mode, uses primary and secondary sources

enumeratedValues.name: RISING_SEC_DIR
enumeratedValues.description: Count rising edges of primary source; secondary source specifies directionRising edges are counted only when SCTRL[IPS] = 0. Falling edges are counted when SCTRL[IPS] = 1.

enumeratedValues.name: SECONDARY
enumeratedValues.description: Edge of secondary source triggers primary count until compare

enumeratedValues.name: CASCADE
enumeratedValues.description: Cascaded counter mode (up/down)The primary count source must be set to one of the counter outputs.

registers.name: SCTRL3
registers.description: Timer Channel Status and Control Register

enumeratedValues.name: INPUT
enumeratedValues.description: The external pin is configured as an input.

enumeratedValues.name: OFLAG_OUT
enumeratedValues.description: The OFLAG output signal is driven on the external pin. Other timer groups using this external pin as their input see the driven value. The polarity of the signal is determined by OPS.

enumeratedValues.name: TRUE
enumeratedValues.description: True polarity.

enumeratedValues.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValues.description: Inverted polarity.

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Capture function is disabled

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE_RISING
enumeratedValues.description: Load capture register on rising edge (when IPS=0) or falling edge (when IPS=1) of input

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE_FALLING
enumeratedValues.description: Load capture register on falling edge (when IPS=0) or rising edge (when IPS=1) of input

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE_BOTH
enumeratedValues.description: Load capture register on both edges of input

registers.name: CSCTRL3
registers.description: Timer Channel Comparator Status and Control Register

enumeratedValues.name: NEVER
enumeratedValues.description: Never preload

enumeratedValues.name: COMP1
enumeratedValues.description: Load upon successful compare with the value in COMP1

enumeratedValues.name: COMP2
enumeratedValues.description: Load upon successful compare with the value in COMP2

enumeratedValues.name: NEVER
enumeratedValues.description: Never preload

enumeratedValues.name: COMP1
enumeratedValues.description: Load upon successful compare with the value in COMP1

enumeratedValues.name: COMP2
enumeratedValues.description: Load upon successful compare with the value in COMP2

enumeratedValues.name: DOWN
enumeratedValues.description: The last count was in the DOWN direction.

enumeratedValues.name: UP
enumeratedValues.description: The last count was in the UP direction.

enumeratedValues.name: STOP
enumeratedValues.description: Stop counter upon receiving a second trigger event while still counting from the first trigger event.

enumeratedValues.name: RELOAD
enumeratedValues.description: Reload the counter upon receiving a second trigger event while still counting from the first trigger event.

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Do not reload the counter on a capture event.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Reload the counter on a capture event.

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Counter can be re-initialized only with the LOAD register.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Counter can be re-initialized with the LOAD or CMPLD2 registers depending on count direction.

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Fault function disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValues.description: Fault function enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValues.description: Continue with normal operation during debug mode. (default)

enumeratedValues.name: HALT_TMR
enumeratedValues.description: Halt TMR counter during debug mode.

enumeratedValues.name: FORCE_0
enumeratedValues.description: Force TMR output to logic 0 (prior to consideration of SCTRL[OPS]).

enumeratedValues.name: HALT_AND_FORCE_0
enumeratedValues.description: Both halt counter and force output to 0 during debug mode.
